DOC.detailed_description: SUMMARY STUDY GOALS : The purpose study demonstrate efficacy FES trans-tibial amputee . The investigator aim demonstrate provide three month FES intervention increase knee extension strength , increase volume residual limb decrease chronic phantom pain . EXPERIMENTAL DESIGN : Randomized control trial METHODS : Twenty participant recruit randomly divide two group , one group receive FES intervention group continue activity daily live . Both group keep daily log number hour prosthesis worn , number hour FES worn ( use ) change skin condition medication . Both group return assessment visit 4 , 8 , 12 week follow visit 3 month post-intervention investigator inspect residual limb check fit prosthetic socket , record residual limb knee extension strength Biodex machine , take measurement ( circumference lengths ) residual limb tape measure ruler , scan limb hand hold three-dimensional motion-tracking laser scanner system participant ask complete pain questionnaire . The Prosthetic Evaluation Questionnaire ( PEQ ) complete 12 week 3 month follow-up visit .
DOC.criteria: Men woman 18 year age . Participants unilateral transtibial amputation minimum 4 '' residual limb . This length amputation choose provide adequate surface area electrode . Participants must minimum two year postoperative insure proper heal limb occur . Participants chronic limb pain . No prior experience use TENS FES . No cardiac condition , hypertension , congestive heart failure , pacemaker . People severe diabetes insensate skin neuropathy .
